attributes.action: ensure MPs set an example in dealing with the country's pensions crisis, by giving up their obscenely expensive & generous, tax payer funded final salary pension scheme.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is fundamentally grotesque to have a group of legislators, who push up the state retirement age, for what is already an extremely poor state pension, when they themselves are not covered by this rule. Watson Wyatt actuaries in 2005, found that anyone working in the private sector would have to accumulate a £1,290,000 pension fund in order to get the same index-linked income for life that a MP can get after less than 27 years of work. A private sector worker would need to save £30,000 p.a. to have the same benefits.
